DOC.HEADLINE: METROPOLITAN DIGEST / LOS ANGELES COUNTY NEWS IN BRIEF : LOS ANGELES ; BLOOD SUPPLY CRITICALLY INADEQUATE , RED_CROSS SAYS
DOC.TEXT: Blood donations throughout the Los Angeles area have been extremely low during the holiday season , leaving supplies critically inadequate , an American Red_Cross spokesman said Tuesday . " People haven ' t signed_up to give blood over the holidays , " said Manuel Rivas of the Los Angeles chapter of the Red Cross. " A lot of people have illnesses , colds and flu , and so didn ' t give blood. " Typically , only about 160 # 000 of the area ' s about 13 million residents give blood each year to the Red_Cross , which supplies blood to all local hospitals . " We ' re trying to increase the number of people who donate blood , " Rivas said . " The Southern California area has not been self-sufficient. " To illustrate the shortage , Rives said the Red_Cross likes to have_on hand 1 # 189 units of O positive blood , the most common type . Currently , only 289 units , or 24 % of the desired amount , are in_stock , he said .
